text: now that Michael Jackson is dead one of
the big questions out there is what
about all of his riches and obviously
what's happened in the last few years is
that much of Michael Jackson's wealth
has possibly disappeared based on
reporting we've done in the paper in the
past he probably made about 700 million
dollars between the mid 80s and the
present we had very valuable assets
primarily his stake in the Beatles
catalogue which he shared with sony Sony
had about 50% of the catalogue Michael
had the other 50% as of late 2005 and at
the time we reported it then the value
of the catalogue was about a billion
dollars but he had blown through so much
money spending on such things as
personalized Bentley's customized art
estates at the time he also owed about
two hundred and seventy million dollars
to a major bank Bank of America and at
that time late 2005 early 2006 there was
a big wrestling match going on over the
rights to his stake in the catalogue if
he couldn't pay the loan back Sony
arranged some lending facilities through
Citigroup and others that allowed
Michael to pay off about two hundred and
seventy million dollars to Bank of
America but still left him encumbered
with a lot of debts that to our
knowledge probably were with him
unfortunately when he died the great
question now is what's gonna happen to
Michael's debts anyone who is owed money
by Michael will be looking towards his
stake in in the Beatles catalog to get
paid off but that probably will result
in a lot of court battles clearly they
had auctioned off parts of the Neverland
Ranch in recent months to pay down some
of his debts
his recent concert tour looked like that
was clearly teed up so he could earn
some more money as tragic and singular
as Michael Jackson's death is we've seen
this before in the business world we've
seen endless legal squabbles over the
rights to the likenesses of Marilyn
Monroe and Elvis Presley
a very notable example of this and it's
easy to predict there's gonna be endless
court squabbles over copywriting Michael
Jackson's name copywriting Michael
Jackson's image monitoring how easily
that his face gets slapped on coffee
cups blankets toasters you name it and I
think people in Hollywood people in the
music industry members of his family and
and a large fleet of lawyers are going
to be engaged in this kind of wrangling
for for many months to come
